intro: Cuphea rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its vibrant red or pink tubular flowers and rounded, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea rotundifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
